question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What integer $n$ satisfies $0\le n<{101}$ and $$-314159\equiv n\pmod {101}~?$$
inference:
$$-314159\equiv n\pmod {101}$$

$$-314159+101\cdot 3100\equiv n\pmod {101}$$

$$310091\equiv n\pmod {101}$$

$$91\equiv n\pmod {101}$$

$$n=\boxed{91}.$$
Final Answer: \boxed{91}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Notice that $100\equiv-1\pmod{101}$.  Therefore  \[310000\equiv-3100\equiv31\pmod{101}.\]Likewise  \[4100\equiv-41\pmod{101}.\]Combining these lets us write  \[314159\equiv 31-41+59\equiv49\pmod{101}.\]However we started with a negative.  We actually want to compute \[-314159\equiv -49\equiv \boxed{52}\pmod{101}.\]
